alert.note: Alert for Ellis; Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 28 at 5:16AM CDT until October 28 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Ellis County in north Texas... Southwestern Kaufman County in north Texas... * Until 900 AM CDT. * At 516 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the cities of Scurry and Kaufman. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waxahachie, Ennis, Terrell, Red Oak, Kaufman, Palmer, Bardwell, Grays Prairie, Alma, Cottonwood, Bardwell Lake, Garrett, Scurry, Bristol, Pecan Hill, Oak Grove, Post Oak Bend City, Rosser, Oak Ridge and Crisp. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Dangerous flash flooding is occurring or is imminent. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing flood waters. If you are in an area subject to flooding, move to higher ground now. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
